dialogue.offer: I'm asthmatic.  I need you to get some kind of medicinal tea for me
dialogue.accepted: Oh, thank god, thank you so much!  I won't last more than a couple of days, so hurry
dialogue.advice: I'm dead unless I can get this special tea.  Maybe it's from a flower?
dialogue.success: Oh thank god!  I'll be right as rain in no time.
dialogue.success_lie: What?!  You're lying, I can tell!  Ugh, forget it!
dialogue.failure: How am I not dead already?!

dialogue.offer: I'm infected.  Badly.  I need you to get something antiseptic for me
dialogue.accepted: Oh, thank god, thank you so much!  I won't last more than a couple of days, so hurry.  Get me some cattail jelly.  That should hopefully be good enough.
dialogue.advice: I think if you can pull cattail jelly out of some cattails from like a swamp or something, I can smear it on the wound.
dialogue.success: Oh thank god!  I'll be right as rain in no time.
dialogue.success_lie: What?!  You're lying, I can tell!  Ugh, forget it!
dialogue.failure: How am I not dead already?!

dialogue.describe: Does our flag still yet wave?  Maybe we will have to make it.
dialogue.offer: You haven't truly visited a place until you've driven a flagpole down into its dirt.  I've got the pole and the paint here, but I need a large canvas for the flag itself.  Get me a large sheet woven out of grass, and we can claim this land in the name of America!
dialogue.accepted: Hell ya!  Fetch me a large grass sheet!  Large enough to be used as a blanket!
dialogue.advice: You'll need to collect some straw and spin it into yarn first.
dialogue.success: America, fuck ya!  I name this land  New New England!  How does that sound?  I like it!
dialogue.failure: You give up?  Our country fell apart because no one could find a good man to rely on, and now you're telling me this place ain't any better?  Might as well give up, I guess.

dialogue.offer: I left my dream journal in the swamp while I was doing my naked snake yoga.  There's some pretty wild stuff in there so I want it back.
dialogue.accepted: Please don't read it unless you are prepared for some graphic and disturbing content.
dialogue.rejected: I know it isn't pressing but I want it.  I have an incredible imagination.  I had a dream about a horse once and it talked.  Amazing stuff.
dialogue.advice: The swamps are pretty dangerous and I'm not really sure where I was.  If you want to just make me a new dream journal that would be all right too.
dialogue.success: Great, let's see  Oh.  Well I can just start over I guess.  My imagination is an endless play place of amazement!
dialogue.failure: Now my nightmares are let loose upon the shivering land.

name.str: Find Patient Records in Leather Journal

dialogue.describe: I hope I don't see many names I know
dialogue.offer: I've lost so many friends please find me a patient list in a leather journal.  I just want to know who might still be out there.
dialogue.accepted: Thank you, I suppose it won't change what has already happened but it will bring me closure.
dialogue.rejected: Please, I just want to know what happened to everyone.
dialogue.advice: You may have some difficulties finding a full list with things how they are.  If you can't get me the list, can you just make or find me a leather journal for me to make my own?
dialogue.success: I'm making a list and checking it twice
dialogue.failure: I bet some of them are still out there

name.str: Find Weather Log in Leather Journal

dialogue.describe: I wonder if a retreat might exist
dialogue.offer: Everyone who dies gets back up, right?  Which means that whatever is causing this it must be airborne to have infected everyone.  I believe that if that is the case then there should be regions that were not downwind from where-ever the disease was released.  We need to find a leather journal with all the weather patterns leading up to the outbreak.
dialogue.accepted: Thanks so much, you may save both of us yet.
dialogue.rejected: Ya, it was a long shot I admit.
dialogue.advice: You may have some difficulties finding those weather pattern records with things how they are.  If you can't get me the list, can you just make or find me a leather journal for me to make my own?
dialogue.success: These look more complicated than I thought, just give me some time.
dialogue.failure: If only we could find a great valley or something.

dialogue.describe: St. Michael the archangel defend me in battle
dialogue.offer: As the world seems to abandon the reality that we once knew, it becomes plausible that the old superstitions that were cast aside may have had some truth to them.  Please go and find me a religious relic I doubt it will be of much use but I've got to hope in something.  It will look like a normal rock to you, but I can divine secrets from its earthly essence.
dialogue.accepted: I wish you the best of luck, may whatever god you please guide your path.
dialogue.rejected: Ya, I guess the stress may just be getting to me
dialogue.advice: I hear rocks may be found in the woods.  They tell me things.  The spirits.  Religion!
dialogue.inquire: Any luck?  Please find me a small relic.  Any relic will do.  It looks like a rock.
dialogue.success: Thank you, I need some time alone now
dialogue.success_lie: What good does this do us?
dialogue.failure: It was a lost cause anyways

dialogue.describe: St. Michael the archangel defend me in battle
dialogue.offer: I have learned so much from this sacred relic.  I have attuned to it.  We must go deeper.  I now understand that buried in the deep forest is a special place with even larger rocks, I mean sacred relics.  Go there, and get me a holy symbol of this place.
dialogue.accepted: I wish you the best of luck, may whatever god you please guide your path.
dialogue.rejected: Ya, I guess the stress may just be getting to me
dialogue.advice: The woods are deep and dark and probably dangerous.  Bring a friend if you can.
dialogue.success: Thank you, this is exactly what I was looking for.
dialogue.success_lie: What good does this do us?
dialogue.failure: It was a lost cause anyways

dialogue.describe: St. Michael the archangel defend me in battle
dialogue.offer: You have no idea how interesting this holy symbol is.  I have two very promising leads first things first, I have learned of dark whispers of mystic significance, telluric resonances that tingle the spine and give me kind of a dizzy feeling, but not entirely unpleasant.  Could you investigate a location for me?  I'm not sure what was going on here but the whispers seem fairly worried about it.
dialogue.accepted: I wish you the best of luck, may whatever god you please guide your path You may need it this time more than the past excursions you have gone on.  There is a whisper about potential human sacrifice in the days immediately before and after the grand mystical shift.  The name of the cult is not revealed to me, except for an incessant squeaking.
dialogue.rejected: Ya, I guess the stress may just be getting to me
dialogue.advice: I doubt the site is still occupied but I'd carry some form of weapon at least I'm not sure what you might be looking for but I'm positive you'll find something out of the ordinary if you look long enough.
dialogue.inquire: I'm positive there is something there there has to be, any luck?
dialogue.success: Thank you, your account of these demonic creations proves the fears the whispers had were well founded.  Our priority should be routing out any survivors of this cult I don't known if they are responsible for the disaster but they certainly know more about it than I do.
dialogue.success_lie: What good does this do us?
dialogue.failure: It was a lost cause anyways

dialogue.describe: St. Michael the archangel defend me in battle
dialogue.offer: I have another task if you are feeling up to it.   There is a mad hermit that the whispers made special mention of.  I was wondering if you could see what may have happened to them or if they left anything behind.  The whispers admit the individual is rather unstable, to put it lightly, but the whispers believe the hermit was some kind of mystical visionary.  I'm not in a position to cast out the account just yet it seems the hermit has prophesied events accurately before.
dialogue.accepted: I wish you the best of luck, may whatever god you please guide your path I can only imagine that the island will be a little slice of hell.  I hope you can swim.
dialogue.rejected: Ya, I guess the stress may just be getting to me
dialogue.advice: With things as they are you probably won't just find a boat lying around.  Maybe make one?  Maybe swim?
dialogue.success: Thank you, I'm not sure what to make of this but I'll ponder your account.
dialogue.success_lie: What good does this do us?
dialogue.failure: It was a lost cause anyways

dialogue.describe: Oh man, I can't believe I forgot to bring it
dialogue.offer: There's some important notes on my special stick that I need.
dialogue.accepted: Thanks!  Just get the stick and bring it to me.
dialogue.advice: Don't worry, you'll know the stick when you see it, it is unmistakable.
dialogue.inquire: So, do you have my stick yet?
dialogue.failure: Wow, you failed?  All that work, down the drain

dialogue.describe: You've seen these walking fungus things around?  I would like to take a closer look at their flesh.  For science.
dialogue.offer: I need someone to get a sample of strange alien fungus chunks and bring it to me.
dialogue.accepted: Excellent.  Get me those nasty chunks.
dialogue.rejected: Are you sure?  The scientific value of those smelly chunks could be priceless
dialogue.advice: I was cutting up a fungus creature in a nearby forest.  I was chased of by a big raven before I could finish, but perhaps you are brave enough to fetch the remains.  Alternatively, you could go and kill and butcher one of those things yourself.
dialogue.inquire: Well, do you have the disgusting chunks yet?
dialogue.success: Excellent!  This may be the key to removing the infection.
dialogue.success_lie: Wait, you couldn't possibly have the nasty chunks!  Liar!
dialogue.failure: What a shame, that horrible chunk could have proved invaluable

dialogue.describe: The eater of the dead something was ripping trees to shreds and only leaving a few scattered limbs
dialogue.offer: A few days ago another survivor and I were in the woods.  One night something caught onto our trail and chased us for ten minutes or so until we decided to split up and meet-up back here.  My buddy never showed up and I don't have the means to kill whatever it was.  Can you lend a hand?
dialogue.accepted: Thanks, make sure you're ready for whatever the beast is.
dialogue.rejected: Hey, I know I wouldn't volunteer for it either.
dialogue.advice: Make sure you have a good weapon.  It sounded pretty big.
dialogue.success: You look a little shaken up, I can't tell you how glad I am that you killed it though.
dialogue.success_lie: Something in the shadows still seems to stare at me when I look at the woods.
dialogue.failure: I'm glad you came back alive I wasn't sure if I had sent you to your death.

dialogue.describe: Oh god, I can't believe it happened
dialogue.offer: My bear she's she was killed, but then she just got back up she's one of those things now.  Can you put her out of her misery for me?
dialogue.accepted: Thank you she would've wanted it this way.
dialogue.rejected: Please reconsider, I know she's suffering
dialogue.advice: She's still a bear, and seemed furious, so be wary.  And please, make it quick
dialogue.inquire: Well?  Did you finish things for my bear?
dialogue.success: Thank you.  I couldn't rest until I knew that was finished.
dialogue.success_lie: What?!  You're lying, I can tell!  Ugh, forget it!

dialogue.offer: I left my stupid dog in the woods, not far from here.  Can you retrieve it?
dialogue.rejected: Please, think of my poor little puppy!
dialogue.inquire: Have you found my dog yet?  His name is Sparky!
dialogue.success: Thank you so much for finding him!
dialogue.success_lie: What?!  You're lying, I can tell!  Ugh, forget it!

name.str: Go into deep woods to retrieve family seeds

dialogue.describe: I need you to get my family seeds from the deep woods.
dialogue.offer: I left some special seeds from my family in the deep woods.  Can you get them?
dialogue.accepted: Thanks, it's great to see someone willing to help out.
dialogue.rejected: Well, I'll find someone else to do it for me, maybe there are a lot of people left
dialogue.advice: I'll know the seeds when I see them.  Just bring me any seeds you find.
dialogue.inquire: Got the seeds?  They're important to me.
dialogue.success: Thanks!  I'll be sure to put in a good word for you around the woods.  With like birds or whatever.

name.str: Gather cattail stalks to create cattail jelly

data.description: Gather <color_light_blue>80 cattail stalks</color> from the swamp and bring them back to <color_light_red>learn how to craft cattail jelly</color>.  Raise your <color_light_blue>survival skill to at least 1</color> by harvesting cattail stalks.  <color_light_blue>Bring back the provided bag</color> as well.

effect.u_message: You learn how to craft cattail jelly.

dialogue.describe: Medical services are a little sparse here, but people have been surviving using their wits and the bounty of Mother Nature for a long time.  Care to learn a little?
dialogue.offer: Did you know that cattails are a source of a jelly that works as an antiseptic and analgesic?  Something like that is likely to be mighty helpful out here.  I want you to take this bag, head to the nearest swamp, collect 80 cattail stalks, and bring them back here.  In exchange, I'll show you how to harvest the jelly.
dialogue.accepted: Great!  This bag should be big enough to hold all of the stalks we'll need.  Don't forget to bring it back.
dialogue.advice: The cattails grow in the fresh water in swamps.  You can't miss them.
dialogue.inquire: Got those cattail stalks yet?  Don't forget to bring back my bag and to work on improving your survival skill as well.
dialogue.success: Great!  Hand them over and I'll show you how this works.

data.//: NPC will ask player to burn tagged forest tile. Will follow player after accepting mission.
data.//2: Change first topic to do proper checks. MGOAL_GO_TO to check if player stands on tagged tile.
data.//3: At the end of the mission, will place fire on tagged tile and NPC will join player faction.

dialogue.describe: Oh man, I want to <swear> burn it so bad
dialogue.offer: I'm so <swear> infuriated!  I've got a tree that ruined my life, and now I want to get revenge!  I don't care about <the_cataclysm>, I just want to burn that tree!  Would you help me, <name_g>?
dialogue.accepted: Good.  Let's go to the tree and <swear> burn it down!  Oh, bring some tinder so we can start the fire.  I can make the sparks.
dialogue.rejected: Seriously?  It's such an easy job
dialogue.advice: Maybe we can find a stick in the woods.
dialogue.success: Sweet, sweet revenge!  Ah, smells so nice!  Feels like the smell of napalm in the morning!  It will all burn to ashes in a matter of minutes.  You helped me get my revenge, so I'll follow you to the end, <name_g>!

data.//: For MISSION_PYROMANIAC. Will spawn fire on tile where PC is standing.
MISSION_PYROMANIAC mission set this topic as starting topic for mission giver.
data.dynamic_line: Are we there yet, <name_g>?  I can't wait to burn that tree!

data.description: Nobody around?  Oh well, it doesn't matter.  Your beloved goats are all you need!

data.name: Lost Tribal
data.description: You were out gathering for the tribe when the sky broke and the gods called to you, then you collapsed.  When you woke up, you were in an unfamiliar place with new memories crowding your thoughts.

data.name: Shaman
data.description: You've trained in the medical arts, refining natural remedies into real cures for disease.  Your tribe would have lived long and healthy lives, were they still here.

data.name: Backpacker
data.description: For the past few years you've been traveling the world, sightseeing and living off tribal donations.  You came home to find your home abandoned, and the only thing between you and death is the open fields and your pack.

data.name: Miner
data.description: You're a miner, not a minor!  Your waterskin is dry, you lost your haul, and you're on your last torch

data.name: Bow Hunter
data.description: Ever since you were a child you loved hunting, and quickly developed a talent for archery.  Why, if the world ended, there's nothing you'd want at your side more than your trusty bow.  So, when it did, you made sure to bring it along.

data.name: Spear Hunter
data.description: Ever since you were a child you loved hunting, and quickly developed a talent for chasing down your prey with a spear.  Why, if the world ended, there's nothing you'd want at your side more than your trusty spear.  So, when it did, you made sure to bring it along.

data.name: Javelin Hunter
data.description: Ever since you were a child you loved hunting, and quickly developed a talent for javelin throwing.  Why, if the world ended, there's nothing you'd want at your side more than your trusty javelins.  So, when it did, you made sure to bring them along.

data.name: Crossbow Hunter
data.description: Ever since you were a child you loved hunting, and crossbow hunting was always your favorite.  Why, if the world ended, there's nothing you'd want at your side more than your trusty crossbow.  So, when it did, you made sure to bring it along, though most of your bolts were lost during the escape.

data.name: Fisher
data.description: You spent most of your days fishing in the swamp, getting by quietly on your catch.  You found the buzzing of insects enjoyable, but recently they've gotten bigger and meaner.  Now their horrible noises have you spooked - you just hope the fish aren't as nasty.
You spent most of your days fishing in lakes and swamps, getting by quietly on your catch.  While you've wandered from your canoe, you can't resist coming back for another catch.

data.name: Redsmith
data.description: You ran into trouble coming out from your forge, but despite the havoc you've managed to keep some of your equipment along with your latest project.

data.name: Survivor
data.description: Some would say that there's nothing particularly notable about you, but you've survived, and that's more than most could say right now.

data.name: Trapper
data.description: You spent most of your life trapping with your father.  Both of you made a decent living selling your catches and running trapping tutorials.  Hopefully, your skills will come in useful against less conventional game.

data.name: Tailor
data.description: Tailoring may not seem like the most useful skill when the world has ended.  Most people wouldn't expect a simple tailor to live very long.  This is your opportunity to prove them wrong.

data.name: Lumberjack
data.description: You're a lumberjack, and you're okay.  You felled trees before the world ended, and you suspect the undead aren't nearly as tough.

data.name: Musician
data.description: You nailed your solo, but the audience erupted into screams instead of applause.  You weren't able to grab much during the panic, but at least you have your flute in your basket.

data.name: Tribal Warrior Recruit
data.description: Joining the tribal guard has been your dream for years.  You finally got in, just in time for your training to get interrupted by some sort of emergency.  As far as you can tell, the elders abandoned you in this hellhole when you missed the emergency evac.
As a member of your tribe's elite guard, you sharpened your swordsmanship to the best that you could.  Now, you're a rnin of the woods.

data.name: Tribal Arbalist
data.description: From your first hunt, you showed talent with a crossbow.  While the tribe was well guarded by your aim, you're all alone now.

data.name: Farmer
data.description: A patch of soil, some water, and sunlight were all you ever needed; why should things be any different now?  With a handful of seeds and your trusty hoe, it's time to rebuild the Earth, one plant at a time.

data.name: Native Settler
data.description: You were on the road with friends from your tribe to search for a new settlement spot when you seemed to be yanked somewhere completely different.  You see no sign of your friends, but at least you got your equipment and some seeds with you.

data.name: Carpenter
data.description: Living under your craftsmanship, the tribe was no longer bound to caves lest they freeze in the night.  You won't have to work nearly as hard for just yourself.

data.name: Bricklayer
data.description: Using the earth and organic material to create durable, insulated adobe kept your trade in high demand in your tribe.  Now alone, you only need to look out for yourself.

The recipe does not require a tool, but something is needed to override the base recipe's tool.

data.description: Practice knitting whatever comes to your mind, from simple forms to elaborate and rich designs.

data.//: the cooking oil isn't supposed to be expended since you can recycle it after frying the burdocks
2 hours of roasting are required to fully break up the toxins in raw pods
Online recipe says prep time 5 min, cook time 1hr. Adjusted batch time to mimic that.
meat = 20u, fat = 15u, vegetable/fruit = 4u, give or take
meat = 20u, fat = 15u, give or take

abstracted chloralkali process, followed by 'burning' resulting chlorine and hydrogen with electric arc as uv source and crucible serving as reaction furnace, then dissolving resulting hydrogen chloride gas in water

another variation of chloralkali process, now used to produce bleach (sodium hypochlorite - or rather rough, technical grade hypochlorite/hydroxide/chloride mix), note we will not be heating anything and that the (mostly) electrochemical reaction easily scales in size, some hydrogen gas could be recoverable (optional byproduct)

abstracting using chloralkali process (hot solution, unpartitioned cell) to produce sodium chlorate, then perchlorate by anodic oxidation on platinum, then ammonia perchlorate by double decomposition from sodium perchlorate and ammonium chloride; while we can't directly use bleach here but we do end up recovering some brine

This is not actually accurate; producing rubber from formic acid and latex generally takes around 12 hours. However, it will be better if we simply create some kind of curing rubber, and let it naturally evolve into rubber chunks from there. Nobody has twelve hours to watch rubber form in a zombie apocalypse.
Should likely come from an entomology text, or something similar, in the future; but still relatively basic.

Melting and reshaping plastic items through the use of vacuum forming molds, per 70 g of plastic. Usually takes 30 minutes per unit.

Crafting cotton items, per 101 g of cotton; 10 g + excessive weight of material is wasted, producing rags and cotton scraps as byproducts.  Time needed is usually 90 minutes per unit if hand-stitching.

Overriding evacuee to put it at the top of the list of available scenarios.
data.name: In a Cave
data.description: Somehow, you found yourself in a cave.  Someone else is with you.

data.name: A Lonely Cave
data.description: Somehow, you found yourself in a cave.  Seems like you're on your own.

data.name: Infected
data.description: In the chaos and panic of evacuation, you got bitten by something!  You didn't get proper medical care, and now the wound has started turning green.

data.name: Challenge - Hunted
data.description: Since the start of the Cataclysm, something has been hunting you relentlessly.  You can outrun it, but it always seems to find you eventually.  The only escape is for one of you to die.

data.name: Challenge - Fungal Infection
data.description: You feel spores crawling beneath your skin.  It's only a matter of time.

data.name: Challenge - Really Bad Day
data.description: You start drunk to the point of incapacitation, depressed, infected, surrounded by fire, and sick with the flu.  This day went downhill really fast.

data.name: Challenge - Bordered
data.description: You have survived the initial wave of panic, and have achieved (relative) safety in a wilderness.  The only thing that really bothers you is a mysterious sky-high wall seen in the distance.

data.name: Ambush
data.description: It is the winter after zero hour.  As you were scavenging for food and a warm place to stay at, you heard the sound of lots of movement nearby.

data.name: The Next Summer
data.description: A little over a year has passed since the apocalypse started, and you're about to face your second summer in Hell.

data.name: Last Flight
data.//: Doesn't seem to spawn the helicopter without a road nearby.  Disabled until this can be fixed.
data.description: Once it became clear that the world was ending you took to the skies, hoping that your flying skills could lead you to safety.  During your flight you got lost and had to land on an empty field.

data.name: Wilderness
data.description: You find yourself amongst trees.  The screaming and the moaning is fainter this far from civilization, but you'd better know what you're doing out here.

data.name: Car Crash
data.description: You decided the open road would be a better prospect than the zombie-filled cities.  While en route to your destination, you were involved in a wreck.  When you look around, you can no longer spot the road you were driving on.  Just how hard did you hit your head?
data.//: Came from a portal storm, so future tech/professions are allowed

data.name: Challenge - Medieval Peasant
data.description: Som nigromancie hath brought yow hidder!  Ye have only the hoose on youre legges and the knyf at youre syde and youre prayeres to Marie moder of God.
A battery for storing electrical power, and discharging it to power electrical devices built into the vehicle.  Contained in a clay shell.

info.name: Slowdown Fungal Growth
info.description: Removes the exponential growth ability of fungaloids.  Deprecated as fungaloids have been removed from the game.

info.name: Railroads
info.description: Enables basic railroad network generation in the world.  <color_red>Not intended for regular gameplay, more for development purposes.</color>

data.name: OVERMAP_PLACE_RAILROADS
data.info: Allows to place procgen railroads during overmap generation.

data.name: OVERMAP_PLACE_RAILROADS_BEFORE_ROADS
data.info: Defines whether to place railroads before roads.

info.name: The Last Generation
info.description: Core content for Cataclysm-TLG.  The game will probably not function without this enabled.
